org.eclipse.papyrus.designer.languages.common.extensionpoints

Interface ILangCodegen

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ILangCodegen2

    public interface ILangCodegen
    Extension point that is implemented by a code generator for a specific programming language

    • Method Detail

      • generateCode

        void generateCode(org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject project,
                  org.eclipse.uml2.uml.PackageableElement element,
                  org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
        Generate code for a specific language
        Parameters:
        project - a project into which code is generated. if null, project is determined automatically (see getTargetProject below)
        element - a packageable element, typically a classifier or a package
        monitor - a progress monitor

      • getTargetProject

        org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject getTargetProject(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.PackageableElement pe,
                                                     boolean createIfMissing)
        Code might be generated into a specific project. It might be the project that hosts the UML file, but it may also be another project that is determined for instance by means of a naming convention (such as a common prefix and the name of the model). This functions locates and returns the target project for the given packageable element. If the project exists, but does not have the nature that is required by the language specific editor, the user is asked whether the nature should be added. Ensures that the target project is correctly setup to contain generated C/C++ code. Does not create a new project, but may modify existing ones.
        Parameters:
        pe - a packageable element within a model
        createIfMissing - if true, a new project is created if it does not exist yet. if false, null is returned if the project does not exist.
        Returns:
        the associated project (or null)

      • getFileName

        String getFileName(org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject project,
                   org.eclipse.uml2.uml.NamedElement element)
        Obtain fileName of file(s) generated for a named element. Delegates to location strategy. Caller must eventually add extensions.
        Parameters:
        project - a project into which code is generated. if null, project is determined automatically
        element - a named element.
        Returns:
        a project relative file name

      • cleanCode

        void cleanCode(org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject project,
               org.eclipse.uml2.uml.PackageableElement element,
               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
        Clean the code for a certain element, i.e. remove code that has previously generated for this element This code is required for differential code generation which needs to remove elements for instance after they have been renamed.
        Parameters:
        project - project in which code should be generated
        element - the element for which the generate code should be removed
